comment: . I know this is a Literature class, but Wow! If you are not familiar with 1800 literature you will get overwhelmed. You have to analyze each piece thoroughly via vista or essay test. Take in person, not online! (speaking directly to mature audiences or those who may have a huge class load)However, instructor very helpful and approachable.

Dr Barrier responds to email quickly but doesn't really follow through on what he says he will do. There are several things that he says he will post that he hasn't posted yet and grades already posted. Read all the material.  I didn't read all of it and got B would have done better if I read everything.

Very nice guy and willing to help but a little shy. Tries to make the class interesting but it didnt work. Soft spoken.  Test are short answer and essay. Each worth 50 points. Boring but is relatively easy.
Very Very nice Professor.  Very fair in his grading.  I took his class over the summer and I am so happy I did.  Ended up with an 87 average.  Loved him
very boring, will put you to sleep if you dont drink plenty of coffee before class, very shy but extremly hopeful and kind!

This was my first hybrid class, and that part sucked, but as far as professors go, Dr. Barrier is a great teacher. He is SO helpful and SUPER nice. He's very approachable; if you have a problem, talk to him about it. He is understanding and is willing to work with his students. Great guy.

What a sweetie. Loves his work but shy in front of the class. Teaches very quietly. LOTS of reading, all from an anthology that might break your wrists. Some interesting pieces, a lot of boring ones. Two big tests. Try to keep up with the reading, even though class discussions do not require knowledge of texts.

Barrier is such a nice guy that I feel horrible saying this, but this class was incredibly boring. There were two tests (both had an essay portion worth 50pts) as well as a final project, and regular WebCT responses to the reading. This class was very time consuming and seemed to last forever. It was a fairly easy A, but oh my gosh was it boring.

Nice guy, but really needs to speak up. Voice is very soft and somewhat monotone. He is really nice about his test, though they are not always easy. At the end, he allowed us to do an online make-up for each, but is full of random info on the authors covered in section. Like I said, nice guy, but if I was to take him again, I would sit front row.
barrier is a man who often seems straight out of the material.

American Lit-Pre-1800: lots of reading but a kind guy who wants students to do well. I found him easy to track down and happy to meet outside class. Read the assignments, participate in class discussion and post on Vista and you'll do fine. He appreciates good writing so u can score points there too. Downside: not the most charismatic lecturer.

Online version. Super nice man, but not good for an online class. Take someone else. His test instructions are so confusing and frustrating, you waste all your time trying to read his mind. He's really slow to return grades too. It's now finals week, and we've only gotten 30% of our grades back. Frustrating class.

Nice man. seems knowledgeable. Does not answer e-mails though. Not easy to find on campus either. Hard to make contact with outside of class. If you like to talk with instructor outside of class, better not take this one. Did well but didn't enjoy the class.
